title.narrative: Conservation of the 4th-5th Century Yereruyk Basilica in Shirak Province

description.narrative: Built between the 4th and 5th centuries, the ancient basilica of Yereruyk is an exemplar of early Armenian church architecture and its ancient Syrian and Hellenistic architectural influences. This project involves the conservation of the church and the preservation of ancient khachkars (cross-stones) and other monumental stone sculptures at the site.

title.narrative: INL Armenia Arzuman Harutyunyan Individual Grant

description.narrative: INL Armenia Arzuman Harutyunyan Individual Grant Covers grants (including revenue- sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes. Includes readjustment and other benefits for veterans, other than indemnities for death or disability.

title.narrative: Preservation of Areni Cave and Artifacts from the Copper Age

description.narrative: Artifacts from the site date back to 5000 BC and are unmatched elsewhere in the world, yet uncontrolled access to the site has led to damage, vandalism, and theft. The project involves the installation of fencing, pathways, and lighting at the site, as well as the stabilization of excavated and partially-exposed artifacts.

title.narrative: Preservation of the Ruins of the 10th-Century Dashtadem Fortress

description.narrative: One of the largest medieval fortresses in Armenia, the ruined fortress encloses a church, reservoir, palace, cemeteries, and a citadel dating from the 7th to the 19th centuries within its walls. This project involves site cleaning and rescue excavation around the ruins and documentation, cataloging, and preservation of artifacts.

title.narrative: Conservation of the 10th-13th-Century Sanahin Monastery, Phase 2

description.narrative: Built between the 10th and 13th centuries, the Sanahin monastery exemplifies the unique architectural style that developed from the blending of Byzantine ecclesiastical architecture and the traditional vernacular architecture of the Caucasus. This project, which continues work begun under a previous AFCP grant, involves the conservation of buildings at the eastern end of the site.
